metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8073 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
WeeChat before 1.7.1 allows a remote crash by sending a filename via DCC to the IRC plugin. This occurs in the irc_ctcp_dcc_filename_without_quotes function during quote removal, with a buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8073` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

weechat - 0.4.2-3ubuntu0.1
weechat-core - 0.4.2-3ubuntu0.1
weechat-curses - 0.4.2-3ubuntu0.1
weechat-plugins - 0.4.2-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: weechat package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.4.2-3ubuntu0.1').
